standard_metadata.standard_description: Use place value understanding to round decimals to any place.

question.content: **Which of the following numbers round to $6.88$ if we're rounding to the nearest hundredth?**

hints.content: Let's place our numbers onto a number line to help us round.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 6.87, four unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 6.875, 4 unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 6.88, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 6.883, five unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 6.889, and an ending tick mark labeled 6.89.

hints.content: The number $\blueD{6.875}$ is closer to $6.88$, so it rounds to $6.88$.   [[☃ image 1]]  The number $\goldD{6.883}$ is closer to $6.88$, so it rounds to $6.88$.   [[☃ image 2]]  The number $\purpleC{6.889}$ is closer to $6.89$ than $6.88$, so it rounds to $6.89$.   [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 6.87 to 6.89 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. An arrow moves five tick marks to the right along the number line from 6.875 to 6.88.
A number line labeled 6.87 to 6.89 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. An arrow moves three tick marks to the left along the number line from 6.883 to 6.88.
A number line labeled 6.87 to 6.89 with tick marks every one thousandth unit. An arrow moves one tick mark to the right along the number line from 6.889 to 6.89.

hints.content: The following numbers round to $6.88$:   - $6.875$ - $6.883$

question.content: **Which two of the following numbers round to $36.2$ if we're rounding to the nearest tenth?**

hints.content: Let's place our numbers onto a number line to help us round.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 36.1, one unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark labeled 36.12, 4 unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 36.17, two unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 36.2, one unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark labeled 36.22, seven unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark labeled 36.3.

hints.content: The number $\blueD{36.12}$ is closer to $36.1$ than $36.2$, so it rounds to $36.1$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The number $\purpleC{36.17}$ is closer to $36.2$, so it rounds to $36.2$  [[☃ image 2]]  The number $\goldD{36.22}$ is closer to $36.2$, so it rounds to $36.2$  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 36.1 to 36.3 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. An arrow moves 2 tick marks to the left along the number line from 36.12 to 36.1.
A number line labeled 36.1 to 36.3 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. An arrow moves 3 tick mark to the right along the number line from 36.17 to 36.2.
A number line labeled 36.1 to 36.3 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. An arrow moves 2 tick marks to the left along the number line from 36.22 to 36.2.

hints.content: The following numbers round to $36.2$:   - $36.17$ -  $36.22$

question.content: **Which two of the following numbers round to $752.3$ if we're rounding to the nearest tenth?**

hints.content: Let's place our numbers onto a number line to help us round.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line that has, moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 752.2, 6 unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 752.27, 2 unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 752.3, 1 unlabeled tick mark, a tick mark labeled 752.32, 3 unlabeled tick marks, a tick mark labeled 752.36, 3 unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark labeled 752.4.

hints.content: The number $\blueD{752.27}$ is closer to $752.3$ than $752.2$, so it rounds to $752.3$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The number $\goldD{752.32}$ is closer to $752.3$, so it rounds to $752.3$  [[☃ image 2]]  The number $\purpleC{752.36}$ is closer to $752.4$ than $752.3$, so it rounds to $752.4$  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 752.2 to 752.4 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. An arrow moves 3 tick marks to the right along the number line from 752.27 to 752.3.
A number line labeled 752.2 to 752.4 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. An arrow moves 2 tick marks to the left along the number line from 752.32 to 752.3.
A number line labeled 752.2 to 752.4 with tick marks every one hundredth unit. An arrow moves 4 tick marks to the right along the number line from 752.36 to 752.4.

hints.content: The following numbers round to $752.3$:   - $752.27$ - $752.32$

question.content: **Which of the following distances round to $4 \text{ m}$ if we're rounding to the nearest meter?**

hints.content: Let's place our numbers onto a number line to help us round.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 3 to 5, with a tick mark every 1 unit. A point labeled 3.490 appears between 3 and 4, closer to 3. A point labeled 3.802 appears between 3 and 4, closer to 4. A point labeled 4.180 appears between 4 and 5, closer to 4.

hints.content: The number $\blueD{3.490}$ is closer to $3$ than $4$, so it rounds to $3$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The number $\goldD{3.802}$ is closer to $4$, so it rounds to $4$.  [[☃ image 2]]  The number $\purpleC{4.18}$ is closer to $4$, so it rounds to $4$.  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 3 to 5 with a tick mark every one unit. An arrow moves one tick mark to the left along the number line from 3.490 to 3.
A number line labeled 3 to 5 with a tick mark every one unit. An arrow moves one tick mark to the right along the number line from 3.802 to 4.
A number line labeled 3 to 5 with a tick mark every one unit. An arrow moves one tick mark to the left along the number line from 4.180 to 4.

hints.content: The following distances round to $4$ meters:  - $4.18 \text{ m}$ - $3.802 \text{ m}$

question.content: **Which of the following amounts round to $\$249$ if we're rounding to the nearest dollar?**

hints.content: Let's place our numbers onto a number line to help us round.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 248 to 250, with a tick mark every 1 unit. A point labeled 248.75 appears between 248 and 249, closer to 249. A point labeled 249.23 appears between 249 and 250, closer to 249. A point labeled 249.75 appears between 249 and 250, closer to 250.

hints.content: The number $\blueD{248.75}$ is closer to $249$, so it rounds to $249$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The number $\goldD{249.23}$ is closer to $249$, so it rounds to $249$.  [[☃ image 2]]  The number $\purpleC{249.75}$ is closer to $250$ than $249$, so it rounds to $250$.  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 248 to 250 with a tick mark every one unit. An arrow moves 1 tick mark to the right along the number line from 248.75 to 249.
A number line labeled 248 to 250 with a tick mark every one unit. An arrow moves 1 tick mark to the left along the number line from 249.23 to 249.
A number line labeled 248 to 250 with a tick mark every one unit. An arrow moves 1 tick mark to the right along the number line from 249.75 to 250.

hints.content: The following amounts round to $\$249$:   - $\$248.75$ - $\$249.23$

question.content: **Which of the following numbers round to $530$ if we're rounding to the nearest ten?**

hints.content: Let's place our numbers onto a number line to help us round.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 520 to 540, with tick marks every 10 units. A point labeled 524.95 appears between 520 and 530, closer to 520. A point labeled 529.07 appears between 520 and 530, closer to 530. A point labeled 534.00 appears between 530 and 540, closer to 530.

hints.content: The number $\blueD{524.95}$ is closer to $520$ than $530$, so it rounds to $520$.  [[☃ image 1]]  The number $\goldD{529.07}$ is closer to $530$, so it rounds to $530$.  [[☃ image 2]]  The number $\purpleC{534}$ is closer to $530$, so it rounds to $530$.  [[☃ image 3]]

images.alt: A number line labeled 520 to 540 with tick marks every ten units. An arrow moves one tick mark to the left along the number line from 524.95 to 520.
A number line labeled 520 to 540 with tick marks every ten units. An arrow moves one tick mark to the right along the number line from 529.07 to 530.
A number line labeled 520 to 540 with tick marks every ten units. An arrow moves one tick mark to the left along the number line from 534.00 to 530.

hints.content: The following number rounds to $530$:   - $529.07$ - $534$

question.content: **Drag the cards to create a number that matches these rules.**    - The number ends in the *tenths* place. - $50$ is the nearest ten when rounding

hints.content: The number ends in the *tenths* place:  $\_ \ \_ \ . \ \_ $

If $8$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{tens}}$ place, our number will round to $80$ or $90$, but not $50$.  If $3$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{tens}}$ place, our number will round to $30$ or $40$, but not $50$.  $\greenD4$ must go in the $\greenD{\text{tens}}$ place.  $\greenD4\ \_ \ . \ \_ $
To round up to $50$, we must have a $5$ or higher in the $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place.    $\blueD8$ is our only choice that is greater or equal to $5$.  $\greenD4\ \blueD8 \ . \ \_ $
So, our last digit, $\purpleC3$, must go in the $\purpleC{\text{tenths}}$ place.
##The answer:  ##$\greenD4 \blueD8  . \purpleC3 $

question.content: **Drag the cards to create a number that matches these rules.**    - The number ends in the *tenths* place. - $20$ is the nearest ten when rounding

hints.content: The number ends in the *tenths* place:  $\_ \ \_ \ . \ \_ $

If $6$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{tens}}$ place, our number will round to $60$ or $70$, but not $20$.  If $4$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{tens}}$ place, our number will round to $40$ or $50$, but not $20$.  $\greenD1$ must go in the $\greenD{\text{tens}}$ place.  $\greenD1\ \_ \ . \ \_ $
To round up to $20$, we must have a $5$ or higher in the $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place.    $\blueD6$ is our only choice that is greater or equal to $5$.  $\greenD1\ \blueD6 \ . \ \_ $
So, our last digit, $\purpleC4$, must go in the $\purpleC{\text{tenths}}$ place.
##The answer:  ##$\greenD1 \blueD6  . \purpleC4 $

question.content: **Drag the cards to create a number that matches these rules.**    - The number ends in the *tenths* place. - $8$ is the nearest one when rounding

hints.content: The number ends in the *tenths* place:  $\_ \ . \ \_ $
Because each card will only be used once, the two possible solutions are $8.7$ and $7.8$.  Which of these numbers rounds to $8$ as its nearest one?
##The answer:  ##$7.8$

question.content: **Drag the cards to create a number that matches these rules.**    - The number ends in the *hundredths* place. - $6$ is the nearest one when rounding

hints.content: The number ends in the *hundredths* place:  $\_ \ . \ \_ \ \_$

If $4$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place, our number will round to $4$ or $5$, but not $6$.  If $9$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place, our number will round to $9$ or $10$, but not $6$.  $\greenD5$ must go in the $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place.  $\greenD5\ . \  \_  \ \_ $
To round up to $6$, we must have a $5$ or higher in the $\blueD{\text{tenths}}$ place.    $\blueD9$ is our only choice that is greater or equal to $5$.  $\greenD5\ . \  \blueD9  \ \_ $
So, our last digit, $\purpleC4$, must go in the $\purpleC{\text{hundredths}}$ place.
##The answer:  ##$\greenD5.\blueD9\purpleC4$

question.content: **Drag the cards to create a number that matches these rules.**    - The number ends in the *thousandths* place. - $2$ is the nearest one when rounding   -  A $2$ is in the thousandths place

hints.content: The number ends in the *thousandths* place:  $\_ \ . \ \_ \ \_ \ \_ $
A $2$ is in the $\purpleC{\text{thousandths}}$ place:   $\_ \ . \ \_ \ \ \_ \ \purpleC2  $

If $1$ goes in the $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place, we need a $5$ or greater in the tenths place to round up to $2$.    We do not have a card with a $5$ or greater.  $\greenD2$ must go in the  $\greenD{\text{ones}}$ place.  $\greenD2\ . \ \_ \  \ \_ \ \purpleC2 $
So, the tenths and hundredths spaces must be filled with $1$'s.
##The answer:  ##$2.112 $

question.content: **Drag the cards to create a number that matches these rules.**    - The number ends in the *hundredths* place. - $2$ is the nearest one when rounding

hints.content: The number ends in the *hundredths* place:  $\_ \ . \ \_ \ \_$
Our tenths digit is $\greenD7$, and our hundredths digit is $\blueD4$:  $\_ \ .\greenD7\blueD4$
If $2$ is the nearest one, our ones digit will be either $1$ or $2$.   The tenths digit of $\greenD7$ means we'll round *up* to the nearest one.   Our ones digit must be $\purpleC1$.
##The answer:  ##$\purpleC1.\greenD7\blueD4$
